caption: Charged me twice as much as they should have. Indian male behind register curses and doesn’t know what he’s doing. Shadiest 7-eleven ever, someone needs to fix it.

I've lived in the neighborhood for several years and I can say without a doubt that this place is pretty bad. As other reviewers have stated, there are often panhandlers outside harassing everyone who goes in and out. More than once I've had someone attempt to pull a scam on me outside.  As for the store itself, it's often quite dirty and usually does not smell that good. The soda machine and Slurpee dispenser are usually in various states of disrepair.
The only place in the neighborhood where I don’t feel safe walking past. I wish management would do a better job at ensuring this place isn’t a blight on the neighborhood.

Most of the neighborhood residents here can't wait for this place to go out of business.   It drains business away from much friendlier, much better local corner stores because the big $$ of 7-11 and this prominent corner gives it so much visibility.  It's pretty bad.    They mark products as one price but when you get to the register it's a higher price.   A lot of things are near or at their expiration dates.    The store is often filthy.    They don't bother with keeping the grounds up at all.  On my last visit the weeds out front were a foot tall.  Customer service is hit or miss.  I have to honestly say I've had reasonably ok service, but more often you just get a cold stare and and outstretched hand demanding your money.  They do have a no panhandling sign up but it's rare that I don't get panhandled by somebody standing in their entryway.   They seem completely unconcerned by this.  Yes I admit I'm part of the problem.  Sometimes I have something on the stove and this is the closest market to me.   So I give in and use them.  But every time I feel like I've contributed to the problem.

All 7elevens are contractually obligated to be miserable experiences, but this place has the added feature of also being a massive health hazard. Don't buy any of their food - it's left to rot under a heat lamp for multiple days, more so than any other 7eleven I've been to.  The staff also seem to delight in crushing every chip bag they handle, probably on purpose. And this 7eleven seems to attract more panhandlers than your average one, so have fun getting harassed every time you enter and exit the store.  This place is a menace to the neighborhood.
I do not like how they sell the customer old food.

I work late nights , around 3ish I go to get coffee, it's cold and been sitting all night.  After you knock on the door for a half hour trying to wake the cashier to get in. And if you have a weak stomach don't go the smell is horrific and if that don't get cha the roaches you'll see were the last straw for me. Go to 8th & H st. N.E. better store hot coffee and the door is never locked
Odd setup inside. Cramped. But, otherwise clean.
The supermarket on the other side of Stanton Park has a wider selection of groceries.
